description:
go/printer: don't forget the .0 in 1.0

(use floating-point rather then integer constant division)

gofmt -w src misc

Fixes issue 3965.

messages.text:
That's the point - he wants 1/4 not 0.0. http://play.golang.org/p/L_zs7wWpjs

-rob

I thought this kind of thing was not required in Go because numbers
are 'perfect' constants?

On Fri, Oct 5, 2012 at 12:58 PM, Benny Siegert <bsiegert@gmail.com> wrote:
> I thought this kind of thing was not required in Go because numbers
> are 'perfect' constants?

http://play.golang.org/p/BbD33_-hF3

-j

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=3ad42a0f9fc6 ***

go/printer: don't forget the .0 in 1.0

(use floating-point rather then integer constant division)

gofmt -w src misc

Fixes issue 3965.

R=r, bsiegert, 0xjnml
CC=bradfitz, golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6610051

Hello r@golang.org (cc: bradfitz@golang.org, golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to

subject: code review 6610051: go/printer, gofmt: don't forget the .0 in 1.0
